thread.title: Exclusive: Manchester United face huge price-hike for transfer target Victor Lindelof
thread.title_full: Exclusive: Manchester United face huge price-hike for transfer target Victor Lindelof

title: Exclusive: Manchester United face huge price-hike for transfer target Victor Lindelof
text:
Premier League Championship Scottish Premiership Exclusive: Manchester United face huge price-hike for transfer target Victor Lindelof JOSE MOURINHO will have to pay £50 million if he wants to land Swedish international central defender Victor Lindelof this summer. By Neil Fissler   
Jose Mourinho could have had the Benfica star for £34.5 million if he had made a move for him during the January transfer window. 
But he opted to wait until the summer believing that Phil Jones partnership with Marcus Rojo would see him through the rest of the season. GETTY Jose Mourinho will have to pay £50million for Victor Lindelof GETTY Jose Mourinho has instead stuck with Marcos Rojo and Phil Jones as his centre-back pairing 
And now Benfica have paid to remove a minimum release clause from Lindelof’s contract and are ready to cash in. 
Italian giants Juventus are also interested in signing the 22 year-old and the Portuguese giants are ready to make Manchester United pay even more to get their man. How Manchester United could look with defender signings worth £98m Tue, January 10, 2017 Manchester United have been linked with moves for Kyle Walker, Danny Rose and Victor Lindelof, but how could Jose Mourinho's defence look with those players in his back-four?
